experience: You and Seve both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Jonathan Cottrell, and 30 others

As a tier 2 Analyst I give technical insight, software implementation , Quality Assurance testing, and troubleshooting efforts for 5 different software products that Mobivity offers. This includes Manual QA testing and automation testing using Postman and Selenium. This ranges from new features of the product and bug fixes from our development team. I also verify issues that are escalated from tier 1, client services, sales, and End-Users of the product. These issues are both technical and customer service related. As a tier 2 I am also the liaison between all departments and our engineering team. Being a tier 2 means that I am considered leadership for our tier 1 team, it is my duty to help our tier 1 team with obtaining a better understanding of our products and processes. This is usually done by creating procedure manuals for our intranet (confluence), one on one training with each team member in regards to our software, and creating new documents that help track and explain processes. This position includes special projects and acting as a single point of contact for our larger clients.

Explore. Chat. Tour.The app that will change the way music moves you.DIY, Together. www.TourKidd.comI am a cofounder and partner of Tourkidd. An online platform for members of the independent music community, providing user-generated data, reviews, communication tools, and show booking functionality for Musicians. My roles within the company includes making executive decisions towards the technology of our company. I am also tasked to hand pick tech processes from The IT infrastructure of the company to the development of the application.

As a Tier 1 Technical support analyst, I was able to provide efficient but friendly troubleshooting and, solutions for all client tiers, ranging from SMB to Enterprise accounts. As the first tier of escalation I was able to offer concentrated technical troubleshooting within the software and pass on any information to our tier 2 support level, This included Reproduction steps, SQL statements, Suggestions of  Multidepartment assistance, and manual QA testing for known issues.
Primavera Online High School & The American Virtual Academy

.		As a helpdesk technician for primavera online high school, I took incoming calls from students, regarding any technical issues they are experiencing with their online classes. These issues would vary and consist of Networking problems, updates on their units, and most importantly any software issues they may experience. It was import to have a well rounded knowledge base of windows, Linux, and Mac operating systems. Some other responsibilities that I had with this job were informing programmers of issues with the Website and software. Any Helpdesk technical support for the offices and other departments. Making sure our network within the office is intact. Also setting up any system for faculty and staff.

As the Development Intern I was given task such as taking down servers and putting up new servers along with migration between servers. I was usually put on projects for front end development, my responsibilities varied due to the projects but is usually consisted of creating wireframes for new projects, going over basic code and editing templates. I was also tasked with setting up static pages and micro sites within wordpress.  Front end work such as HTML and CSS edits within wordpress and bootstrap environments were routine. I was also the only employee in charge of IT for the office.
